function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential sensitivity of bacteria in deionized water to UVGI compared to bacteria in droplet nuclei","Impact":"Inadequate UVGI sensitivity could lead to ineffective disinfection in environments with infectious droplet nuclei","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough testing to understand the effectiveness of UVGI on bacteria in various conditions, and adjust installation and maintenance processes accordingly","Technologies":"Thorough testing protocols, adjustable UVGI systems","People":"Building occupants, infected individuals, maintenance personnel","Owner":"Maintenance personnel, infectious disease specialists"},{"Description":"Lack of regulation and standardization for UVGI installation techniques","Impact":"Inconsistent and potentially ineffective UVGI installation techniques could lead to harm for building occupants and maintenance personnel","Mitigation":"Establish and enforce industry standards for UVGI installation and maintenance, and provide training and certification for installation technicians","Technologies":"Regulatory standards, training and certification programs","People":"Building occupants, maintenance personnel, installation technicians","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, industry associations, manufacturers"},{"Description":"Risk to maintenance personnel during UVGI applications in AHU and ductwork","Impact":"Increased risk of harm to maintenance personnel due to close proximity to UVGI source, despite short exposure time","Mitigation":"Implement strict safety protocols and training for maintenance personnel, and design protective measures for working near UVGI sources","Technologies":"Safety protocols, training programs, protective equipment","People":"Maintenance personnel","Owner":"Maintenance personnel, occupational safety specialists"}]}
